intro: Copaifera trapezifolia, commonly known as Brazilian copaiba, is a tropical tree native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, resinous sap. The plant produces yellowish to reddish resin, which has been traditionally used for medicinal purposes. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy surface. Copaifera trapezifolia typically grows in humid lowland forests and can reach heights of up to 30 meters.
